newsitem.title: FRANCE: Pathe, Canal Plus in film deal.
newsitem.headline: Pathe, Canal Plus in film deal.

text.p: French media company Pathe and pay-television group Canal Plus said on Wednesday they signed an agreement to set up a European film distribution network.
"The main objective of this association is to promote the distribution of locally produced European movies in Europe," a joint statement said.
Initially the network will associate five leading local distributors in France (AMLF), in the UK (Guild Pathe), Germany (Tobis), Spain (Sogepaq) and Italy.

The network will distribute movies produced or acquired by Pathe and Canal Plus. Tt will also market movies produced outside Europe, as Pathe and Canal Plus will together have the capacity to acquire the European rights to these movies.
Pathe fully owns AMLF and Guild Pathe and is the main shareholder in Tobis. Canal Plus has interests in Sogepaq via Sogecable.
The Canal Plus group also holds interests in the Canal Plus pay-TV channel in Spain, Premiere in Germany and Telepiu in Italy.
Pathe is the second largest shareholder of BSkyB in the UK
